SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.util

Class XMLParseUtils

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.util.XMLParseUtils
public final class XMLParseUtils extends Object
Utility methods for parsing XML using the Gonzalez streaming parser.

These methods provide non-blocking, NIO-based XML parsing using the Gonzalez push-model parser. For file-based parsing, NIO FileChannel is used. For InputStream-based parsing (e.g., resources from JAR files), the stream is wrapped in a ReadableByteChannel.

Parser instances are reused via a thread-local cache to avoid the overhead of creating new parsers for each document. The parser's reset() method is called between documents to clear internal state.

Entity Resolution

When using the non-blocking receive() interface, the systemId and publicId must be set before the first receive() call. This is necessary for documents that are not standalone and need to resolve external entities (e.g., DTD references). The systemId provides the base URI for relative entity resolution, while the publicId can be used for catalog- based resolution.

Example usage: 

 XMLParseUtils.parseFile(configFile, myHandler, null, null, null);
 XMLParseUtils.parseStream(inputStream, myHandler, null, "config.xml", null);
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Method Details

    • parseFile

      public static void parseFile(File file, ContentHandler contentHandler, ErrorHandler errorHandler, String systemId, String publicId) throws IOException, SAXException
      Parses an XML file using NIO FileChannel. This is the most efficient method for parsing local files.
      Parameters:
      file - the XML file to parse
      contentHandler - the SAX content handler to receive events
      errorHandler - optional SAX error handler (may be null)
      systemId - optional system ID for error reporting and entity resolution (uses file URI if null)
      publicId - optional public ID for catalog-based entity resolution (may be null)
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      SAXException - if a parsing error occurs

    • parseURL

      public static void parseURL(URL url, ContentHandler contentHandler, ErrorHandler errorHandler) throws IOException, SAXException
      Parses an XML document from a URL. Opens a stream to the URL and parses using the stream method. The URL string is used as the systemId for entity resolution.
      Parameters:
      url - the URL to parse
      contentHandler - the SAX content handler to receive events
      errorHandler - optional SAX error handler (may be null)
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      SAXException - if a parsing error occurs

    • parseStream

      public static void parseStream(InputStream in, ContentHandler contentHandler, ErrorHandler errorHandler, String systemId, String publicId) throws IOException, SAXException
      Parses an XML document from an InputStream. The stream is wrapped in a ReadableByteChannel for efficient reading.
      Parameters:
      in - the InputStream to parse (will NOT be closed by this method)
      contentHandler - the SAX content handler to receive events
      errorHandler - optional SAX error handler (may be null)
      systemId - optional system ID for error reporting and entity resolution
      publicId - optional public ID for catalog-based entity resolution (may be null)
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      SAXException - if a parsing error occurs

    • parseStreamWithDigest

      public static void parseStreamWithDigest(InputStream in, ContentHandler contentHandler, ErrorHandler errorHandler, String systemId, MessageDigest digest) throws IOException, SAXException
      Parses an XML document from an InputStream while computing a digest. Useful for deployment descriptor parsing where digest is needed.
      Parameters:
      in - the InputStream to parse (will NOT be closed by this method)
      contentHandler - the SAX content handler to receive events
      errorHandler - optional SAX error handler (may be null)
      systemId - optional system ID for error reporting and entity resolution
      digest - the MessageDigest to update with read data
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      SAXException - if a parsing error occurs
